title: Add 6 additional classic games to Retro Arcade

requirements.text: Add six additional classic games to the arcade, each with a dedicated playable React/TypeScript game page that matches the existing UI/UX patterns used by current games (header back button, score panel, how-to-play panel, pause/reset controls where applicable, and an end-of-game score submission dialog that submits scores to the backend). The six games to add are: Centipede, Missile Command, Pinball, Bubble Shooter, Q*bert, and Dig Dug.

quotes: Caffe can you add 6 more games and can you make them classic games pleas

acceptanceCriteria: There are 6 new routes (one per new game) that render a playable game (not a placeholder screen).
Each new game page displays: Back to Games navigation, a visible score display, a How to Play section, and controls consistent with existing games (Start/Pause/Reset where applicable).
Each new game triggers a game-over (or equivalent end-of-run) state and shows a score submission dialog that calls the existing score submission flow.
User-facing text on the new pages is in English.

requirements.text: Extend the Motoko backend (single actor in backend/main.mo) to recognize the six new games (Centipede, Missile Command, Pinball, Bubble Shooter, Q*bert, Dig Dug) in getAvailableGames(), and to store/retrieve high scores for each via getHighScores(), getPlayerScore(), and submitScore() without trapping or returning an empty non-persistent map for these game names.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo getAvailableGames() includes 6 new entries with name, description (English), and thumbnail fields for the new games.
backend/main.mo getGameScores() returns a dedicated persistent score map for each of the 6 new game names (no fall-through to the default empty map case for these names).
Submitting and retrieving scores works for each new game (scores appear in descending order in getHighScores).

requirements.text: Update frontend routing and navigation so the six new games are reachable from the app: add routes in frontend/src/App.tsx, add Home page card navigation mappings (route + preview image mappings) in frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx, and update Leaderboard navigation mapping in frontend/src/pages/LeaderboardPage.tsx so the "Play {game.name}" button works for all available games including the six newly-added games.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page shows 6 additional game cards returned by getAvailableGames(), and the Play Now button navigates to the correct new game route for each new game.
/leaderboard loads tabs from backend getAvailableGames() (existing behavior) and the "Play {game.name}" button navigates correctly for each of the six new games.
All new routes render without runtime errors (no undefined route/image lookups for the new game names).

requirements.text: Add static preview images for the six new games under frontend/public/assets/generated using the existing preview image convention, and render them on the Home page game cards via the existing gameImages mapping.
acceptanceCriteria: Six new preview image files exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames specified in imageRequirements.required.
Home page cards for the six new games render these preview images (no broken image icons).

requirements.text: If adding the six new backend score maps changes stable state shape compared to deployed versions, add/adjust backend/migration.mo so existing deployments can upgrade without trapping and existing stored scores for current games remain intact.
acceptanceCriteria: Upgrade path does not trap when deploying the updated canister over an existing one.
Existing game scores (for already-supported games) remain accessible after upgrade.
New games have initialized score storage after upgrade (empty leaderboards are allowed).

constraints: Backend must remain a single-actor Motoko canister (all logic in backend/main.mo).

Do not edit frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing components instead).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Introducing external databases or non-Motoko backend services.
